The alleged problem is a pop-up error stating that the app is damaged. It's a security issue that can be triggered by some apps: if you disable SIP (System Integrity Protection), you won't experience any of this. 
But there's also a safe and easy workaround: open the Terminal (it's located in Applications/Utilities), paste " xattr -cr /Applications/League\ of\ Legends.app" (without the quotation marks, of course) and then press Return. Done.    

Riot could easily solve this, just like the mic issue that had be troubleshooted by Reddit users (a solution of which many are probably unaware). I hope they finally take the chance to fix both bugs (and maybe, while they're at it, the minimisation one too).

Mac has never really gotten much love when it comes to games sadly. It has a smaller population of users, but I do wish it got some attention.

You're basically going to temporarily disable the SIP I was talking about (which isn't that useful at all, hackintoshes run 24/7 with SIP disabled and aren't any less safe, de facto), in order to add an "exception" for the OS to let LoL access the microphone.

> [{quoted}](name=AlmostKindaLucky,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=GQg45RBw,comment-id=00020004,timestamp=2019-11-04T19:59:26.970+0000)

Are you executing the command as root? I guess that may be the reason why it didn't work. Try both su and sudo: "su xattr -cr /Applications/League\ of\ Legends.app" or "sudo xattr -cr /Applications/League\ of\ Legends.app". Be sure to be on bash and not zsh, also the above commands only work if you LoL is located in your default Applications folder (otherwise, you need to change the path).
